intro: Lophogyne lacunosa, commonly known as the hollow-leaf lophogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hollow stems and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Lophogyne lacunosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and coastal areas.
